description: The root cause for the issue at hand stems from an ineffective manual update process for the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) across various Windows 11 versions. With the introduction of the latest cumulative updates for Windows 11 versions 22H2 and 23H2, this process has been automated, ensuring that WinRE is updated seamlessly without requiring additional user intervention. This automation targeting WinRE is particularly beneficial for systems receiving updates via Windows Update and WSUS. The mitigation is linked to CVE-2024-20666 and is addressed in the cumulative updates, as documented in the KB article. The elimination of manual steps significantly reduces the potential for errors and increases the reliability of the recovery environment, thus enhancing overall system resilience and recovery processes.
